meanings.definition: The threshold of a physiological or psychological response.
meanings.sent1: When the music reached a certain limens, she couldn't help but start dancing.
meanings.sent2: The limens of his patience was reached when he finally snapped at his annoying coworker.
meanings.sent3: At the limens of hunger, he couldn't resist the temptation of the freshly baked cookies.
meanings.sent4: The limens of fear was like a wall blocking her path to success.
meanings.sent5: The limens of excitement was so high that she could hardly contain her joy.

meanings.definition: The smallest detectable stimulus or the weakest detectable sensation.
meanings.sent1: The limens of the sound was so faint that only the dog could hear it.
meanings.sent2: She could feel the limens of the breeze on her skin as she stood by the window.
meanings.sent3: The limens of the scent was so subtle that it took her a moment to recognize the familiar perfume.
meanings.sent4: The limens of pain was like a tiny prick compared to the sharp ache that followed.
meanings.sent5: The limens of touch was so delicate that it felt like a feather brushing against her skin.
